title: Removing notes from Mendelssohn overture shows plight of humpback whales
description: Hebrides Redacted is meant to show "how human activities have silenced nature.”

title: Since Crew Dragon’s debut SpaceX has flown more astronauts than anyone
description: "Thank you for an incredible ride up to orbit and an incredible ride home."

title: Apple’s AR/VR headset will scan your iris when you put it on
description: Apple's headset will also scan users' legs for inclusion in virtual space.

title: AT&T to pay $23M fine for bribing powerful lawmaker’s ally in exchange for vote
description: AT&T said it's "committed to ensuring that this never happens again."

title: Equifax surveilled 1,000 remote workers, fired 24 found juggling two jobs
description: Equifax used its own worker surveillance product to spy on workers fired.

title: BA.5 is finally fading—sublineages BQ.1 and BQ.1.1 rise from variant stew
description: BQ.1 and BQ.1.1 now account for 1-in-10 US COVID infections.

title: Musk says Starlink can’t keep providing Ukraine broadband unless Pentagon pays
description: SpaceX and US in talks, but Pentagon says it has "other" satellite options.

title: The Pixel 7 tests out 64-bit-only Android, can’t run 32-bit apps
description: 64-bit only Android promises better performance and security, if we can get there.

title: Dwarf Fortress, the most inscrutable game of two decades, is getting a tutorial
description: Start off in a mineral-rich play area with hints, rather than primordial chaos.

title: Brazil court orders Apple to reimburse customers for charger-less iPhones
description: iPhones sold without chargers is an "abusive practice," São Paulo judge says.

title: Nvidia will “unlaunch” the 12GB RTX 4080, says it’s “not named right”
description: Nvidia had taken heat for announcing two 4080 cards with wildly divergent specs.

title: Researchers make cyborg cockroaches that carry their own power packs
description: Solar cell and a battery can keep the cyborg's electronics running for weeks.

title: Only PC players need a registered phone number for Modern Warfare 2
description: Security measure comes on top of Ricochet's required kernel-level drivers.

title: How a Microsoft blunder opened millions of PCs to potent malware attacks
description: Microsoft said Windows automatically blocked dangerous drivers. It didn't.

title: TikTok made money from getting Syrian refugees to beg in livestreams
description: A BBC investigation found that TikTok was taking up to 70% of profits.

title: The next Ford Mustang won’t be easy to tune; blame cybersecurity
description: The price of digital security might be your new car eternally remaining stock.

title: Microsoft preps DirectStorage 1.1 with GPU decompression for faster game loads
description: Update is "coming soon" but requires use of all-new compression format.

title: Elon Musk is under federal investigation for merger conduct, Twitter tells judge
description: Musk refuses to produce communications with SEC and FTC, Twitter tells court.

title: Big pharma says drug prices reflect R&D cost. Researchers call BS
description: A new study finds no correlation between R&D spending and outlandish drug prices.

title: Rocket Report: Amazing view of Falcon 9 landing, spaceport suit Down Under
description: "We remain confident of achieving our objective of a full vertical orbital launch."

title: AMD Ryzen 7 7700X review: Performance that’s great but a price that isn’t
description: But the total cost of buying into AMD's new platform still makes it a tough sell.

title: “So much screaming inside me“—Google Stadia shutdown stuns indie developers
description: Game makers were still working on their ports when shutdown news went public.
